page.title: 20THE TARRANT STREAM
page.content: The Tarrant is a chalk stream.It rises at a place called Stubhampton,a few miles north of Tarrant Hinton and flows down the valey to join the River Stour at Spettisbury which is about 4 miles SE of Blandford.In winter or after a lot of rain the Tarrant can be quite deep and flows swiftly and the ford at Tarrant Monkton can be too deep for cars to cross.In summer it dries up for much of its length especially from Tarrant Hinton to new Monkton.Springs provide some water most of the year although the ford is often dry in the summer months. These pages have been compiled by classes 3G and 3W of Milldown Middle School,Blandford in Dorset.
